title: Hiring Java Full Stack Developers
jobDescription:
Title: Full-Stack Java Engineer


Job Description:


We are seeking a highly skilled Full-Stack Java Engineer to join our dynamic software development team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing scalable, high-quality web applications using Java and related technologies.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code for both front-end and back-end components of the application.
  • Develop user interfaces using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and front-end frameworks like Angular or React.
  • Implement robust backend services and APIs using Java with frameworks like Spring Boot, and Hibernate.
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, UX designers, and other engineers, to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Maintain code integrity and organization, following best practices and design patterns.
  • Write unit and integration tests to ensure software quality.
  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to team and personal learning.

Qualifications:


  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven hands-on Software Development experience with Java and Java EE.
  • Proficient in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and a modern JavaScript framework (Angular, React, Vue.js).
  • Extensive experience with server-side development using Spring Framework (Spring MVC, Spring Security, Spring Data, etc.).
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming, design patterns, and microservices architecture.
  • Experience with database technologies (SQL and NoSQL) and ORM tools (JPA, Hibernate).
  • Experience with version control systems such as Git.
  • Knowledge of build tools (e.g., Maven, Gradle) and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker, and orchestration tools like Kubernetes is a plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.

Preferred Skills:


  • Experience with Agile development
  • Familiarity with cloud services and providers (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Experience with testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito, Selenium).
  • Knowledge of web server configuration and deployment (Apache, Tomcat).

The Full-Stack Java Engineer will be expected to have a passion for tech innovation and an eagerness to learn new technologies to keep up with the evolving landscape of web applications. The role demands dedication, the ability to multitask, and strong interpersonal skills to effectively work with team members and stakeholders.

title: Senior Java Developer
jobDescription:
Join us in creating the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on peoples lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

Be part of a culture built on an inclusive way of working where we are open to your ideas, you are empowered to take risks and are encouraged to be fearless in bringing your authentic self to work.

The team you'll be part of

The pandemic has highlighted how important telecom networks are to society. The Cloud and Network Services (CNS) business group is a growth engine for Nokia. Our focus is to create value for both service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models as demand for critical networks accelerates.

In CNS, you will be part of Core Networks Services & Care (S&C) organization. This group is at the heart of a revolution to bring faster and reliable networks to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.

What you will learn and contribute to

We are looking for Senior Java Developers who could lead the development effort on a variety of projects in a highly collaborative, dynamic environment designing Java-based creative solutions to telco network use cases.

Software Senior Java developers are expected to work closely with other stakeholders such as product and market, designers, and other software engineers to develop new product offerings and improve the efficiency of the solution.

Required Skills:

   University degree in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Electronics or equivalent degree
   Minimum 4 years of experience in Java/J2EE programming and Python programming,
   Deep knowledge on object-oriented concepts
   Experience in software development concepts (Design Patterns, Test Driven Development, Agile etc.)
   Experience in at least one RDBMS (Oracle, MySQL etc.)
   Knowledge and/or experience in XML, Web services
   Hands-on experience in Code Versioning Systems like Gerrit/Git, SVN etc.
   Experience in Eclipse IDE
   User and/or Admin level knowledge in Unix-based systems
   Experience developing, executing and supporting IT cloud solutions On Openstack, AWS, Azure, VMware
   Experience of Docker, Ansible, Kubernetes
   Experience in DevOps tools Jenkins for CI/CD.
   Knowledge and experience with the professional services project lifecycle (scoping, requirements, construction, QA/test)

What we offer

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

  • One of the Worlds Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
  • Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
  • Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
  • LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.

 Nokias employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

 Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

title: Senior Principal Software Developer-Core banking
tagsAndSkills: Cloud Technologies,Microservices,OCI,Cloud Architecture,Cloud Infrastructure Management,Web-tier development,Development,OTM
jobDescription:
Senior Principal Software Developer

Location is Bangalore or Chennai

As a Senior Principal Software Developer you will be responsible for designing highly scalable cloud-based solutions, overseeing high-volume transaction processing capabilities, and playing a pivotal role in crafting effective product architecture and strategy to meet the needs of Corporate Banking Functions. Additionally, you'll address non-functional requirements including performance, high availability, scalability, and security.

As a "Senior Principal Software Developer" should be a strong communicator, who has experience designing and implementing multiple complex distributed cloud services from start to finish with excellent communication skills, with a successful track record of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced development environment.• Candidate will be working on Oracle Banking Accounts Product• Architect, develop and maintain Microservices using microservices frameworks (Spring Boot with Spring Cloud ,Oracle Helidon, Coherence Distributed Data Grid)• Devise and implement solutions that allow the system to linearly scale better• Document technical knowledge and proposed architecture and present to peers and other engineers• Mentor engineers & Review code developed by other engineers• Ensure compliance with development methodology and technical process• Candidate should possess the ability to review deployments and operational environments, i.e., execute initiatives to reduce failure, troubleshoot issues across the entire infrastructure stack, expand monitoring capabilities, and manage technical operations.

As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures for a cloud based solution. You will Define specifications and provide innovative design strategies for a addressing the increasing demands in the corporate Banking Domain handling huge transaction volumes processing and effective utilization of the cloud resources. Mentor and develop software according to those specifications or Strategies. You will perform professional software development tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications.

Technical skills:

Experience designing Enterprise Cloud Services
• Microservices development using microservices frameworks (Spring Boot with Spring Cloud ,Oracle Helidon)
• Experience with Web-tier development technologies such as Spring, JPA.
• Working knowledge of Linux/UNIX
• Working knowledge of Oracle DB and SQL
• Experience working with Kafka / RabbitMQ or other messaging services
• Working knowledge with IaaC tools like Dockers, Kubernetes, Terraform and Ansible
• Git / SVN version control experience
• Programming / scripting in BASH / Python / sh
• Experience with any cloud infrastructure (OCI, AWS, GCP. Azure)
• Experience with Agile methodology and Scrum.
• Experience in Banking domain is a plus"

title: Java Springboot Microservices Developer
jobDescription:
A career within Enterprise Architecture services, will provide you with the opportunity to bring our clients a competitive advantage through defining their technology objectives, assessing solution options, and devising architectural solutions that help them achieve both strategic goals and meet operational requirements. We help build software and design data platforms, manage large volumes of client data, develop compliance procedures for data management, and continually researching new technologies to drive innovation and sustainable change.

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Java Spring Boot Microservices Developer to
join our dynamic team. As a Senior Developer, you will be responsible for designing,
developing, and maintaining microservices-based applications using Java and Spring
Boot. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in Java development,
hands-on experience with Spring Boot and microservices architecture, and a passion for
building scalable and resilient software solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and deploy microservices-based applications using Java and Spring Boot.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, define project scope, and architect solutions.
  • Implement RESTful APIs and integrate with third-party services and APIs.
  • Design and develop data models and databases for microservices using technologies like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
  • Implement security measures such as OAuth, JWT, and SSL/TLS to protect microservices and APIs.
  • Implement caching strategies and optimize performance for high- traffic microservices.
  • Implement monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure the health and availability of microservices.
  • Write unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests to ensure the quality and reliability of microservices.
  • Work closely with DevOps engineers to automate build, deployment, and testing processes using tools like Jenkins, Docker,and Kubernetes.
  • Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and other agile development activities.
  • Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance and
  • support as needed.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related
    field.
  • 3-6 years of experience in Java development, with a focus on
    Spring Boot and microservices.
  • Proficiency in Java, Spring Framework (including Spring Boot), and related technologies.
  • Strong understanding of microservices architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
  • Experience with RESTful API design and implementation.
  • Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and/or NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
  • Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions on time and within budget.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with message brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.
  • Knowledge of reactive programming frameworks such as Spring WebFlux or Akka.
  • Experience with monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack.
  • Certification in Java, Spring Boot, or related technologies is a plus.

Mandatory skill sets -Java Springboot microservices, cloud platforms - AWS/Azure/GCP with CI/CD experience, NoSQL, MongoDB

Preferred skill sets

Preferred Qualifications : Experience with message brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ. Knowledge of reactive programming frameworks such as Spring WebFlux or Akka. Experience with monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack. Certification in Java, Spring Boot, or related technologies is a plus.

Qualifications -B.E. / B.Tech / MCA/ M.E/ M.TECH/ MBA/ PGDM. All qualifications should be in regular full-time mode with no extension of course duration due to backlogs

Senior Principal Software Developer

Location is Bangalore or Chennai

As a Senior Principal Software Developer you will be responsible for designing highly scalable cloud-based solutions, overseeing high-volume transaction processing capabilities, and playing a pivotal role in crafting effective product architecture and strategy to meet the needs of Corporate Banking Functions. Additionally, you'll address non-functional requirements including performance, high availability, scalability, and security.

As a "Senior Principal Software Developer" should be a strong communicator, who has experience designing and implementing multiple complex distributed cloud services from start to finish with excellent communication skills, with a successful track record of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced development environment.• Candidate will be working on Oracle Banking Accounts Product• Architect, develop and maintain Microservices using microservices frameworks (Spring Boot with Spring Cloud ,Oracle Helidon, Coherence Distributed Data Grid)• Devise and implement solutions that allow the system to linearly scale better• Document technical knowledge and proposed architecture and present to peers and other engineers• Mentor engineers & Review code developed by other engineers• Ensure compliance with development methodology and technical process• Candidate should possess the ability to review deployments and operational environments, i.e., execute initiatives to reduce failure, troubleshoot issues across the entire infrastructure stack, expand monitoring capabilities, and manage technical operations.

As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures for a cloud based solution. You will Define specifications and provide innovative design strategies for a addressing the increasing demands in the corporate Banking Domain handling huge transaction volumes processing and effective utilization of the cloud resources. Mentor and develop software according to those specifications or Strategies. You will perform professional software development tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications.

Technical skills:

Experience designing Enterprise Cloud Services
• Microservices development using microservices frameworks (Spring Boot with Spring Cloud ,Oracle Helidon)
• Experience with Web-tier development technologies such as Spring, JPA.
• Working knowledge of Linux/UNIX
• Working knowledge of Oracle DB and SQL

• Experience with Agile methodology and Scrum.
• Experience in Banking domain is a plus"

title: Java Springboot Microservices Developer
jobDescription:
A career within Enterprise Architecture services, will provide you with the opportunity to bring our clients a competitive advantage through defining their technology objectives, assessing solution options, and devising architectural solutions that help them achieve both strategic goals and meet operational requirements. We help build software and design data platforms, manage large volumes of client data, develop compliance procedures for data management, and continually researching new technologies to drive innovation and sustainable change.

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Java Spring Boot Microservices Developer to
join our dynamic team. As a Senior Developer, you will be responsible for designing,
developing, and maintaining microservices-based applications using Java and Spring
Boot. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in Java development,
hands-on experience with Spring Boot and microservices architecture, and a passion for
building scalable and resilient software solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and deploy microservices-based applications using Java and Spring Boot.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, define project scope, and architect solutions.
  • Implement RESTful APIs and integrate with third-party services and APIs.
  • Design and develop data models and databases for microservices using technologies like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
  • Implement security measures such as OAuth, JWT, and SSL/TLS to protect microservices and APIs.
  • Implement caching strategies and optimize performance for high- traffic microservices.
  • Implement monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure the health and availability of microservices.
  • Write unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests to ensure the quality and reliability of microservices.
  • Work closely with DevOps engineers to automate build, deployment, and testing processes using tools like Jenkins, Docker,and Kubernetes.
  • Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and other agile development activities.
  • Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance and
  • support as needed.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related
    field.
  • 3-6 years of experience in Java development, with a focus on
    Spring Boot and microservices.
  • Proficiency in Java, Spring Framework (including Spring Boot), and related technologies.
  • Strong understanding of microservices architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
  • Experience with RESTful API design and implementation.
  • Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and/or NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
  • Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions on time and within budget.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with message brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.
  • Knowledge of reactive programming frameworks such as Spring WebFlux or Akka.
  • Experience with monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack.
  • Certification in Java, Spring Boot, or related technologies is a plus.

Mandatory skill sets -Java Springboot microservices, cloud platforms - AWS/Azure/GCP with CI/CD experience, NoSQL, MongoDB

Preferred skill sets

Preferred Qualifications : Experience with message brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ. Knowledge of reactive programming frameworks such as Spring WebFlux or Akka. Experience with monitoring and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack. Certification in Java, Spring Boot, or related technologies is a plus.

  • Contribute to architectural decisions and best practices.
  • Mentor junior engineers and provide technical leadership.

What experience or knowledge should you bring?
  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science/Software Engineering from a reputable university OR minimum 4 years of hands-on experience with object-oriented programming using Python, Java, Go, C++, or similar languages with experience in unit and integration testing.
  • Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly and grasp complex functionalities of software products.
  • Working experience with RDBMS (PostgreSQL/MySQL), Redis, Kafka for data storage and messaging.
  • Prior experience in developing scalable and robust software systems.
  • Solid understanding of Kubernetes and Docker as deployment platforms
  • Working knowledge of at least one major cloud platform (AWS, GCP, or Azure) is required.

title: DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
About the role

We are seeking a passionate and skilled AWS Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, deploying, and managing our infrastructure on the AWS cloud platform. You will also play a key role in automating our DevOps pipeline using Jenkins to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.


Responsibilities

  • Firsthand Management: This role requires experience in managing core AWS services including EC2, S3, VPC, RDS, WAF, GuardDuty, ECS (Elastic Container Service), and ALB (Application Load Balancer). You will be responsible for provisioning, configuring, and maintaining these services to

meet our infrastructure needs.

  • Automation Expertise: We leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and scripting to automate

infrastructure management. You will be an expert in shell scripting and adept at using Terraform

(a plus) to define and manage our infrastructure as code.

  • Containerization Champion: Docker containers are essential to our development process. You

will need strong Docker skills to build, package, and deploy containerized applications on ECS.

Experience with Kubernetes, a container orchestration platform, is a plus.

  • Modern Development Skills: While not required, experience with NodeJS and Python will be

highly regarded. These skills can be instrumental in automating tasks and developing DevOps

tools.

  • CI/CD Master: You will be instrumental in implementing and managing our CI/CD pipeline using

Jenkins (mandatory). This includes defining build jobs, configuring automated testing, and

deploying applications to production on ECS behind an ALB.


Required experience & skillsets:

  • 2-4 years of experience in cloud computing, preferably AWS.
  • Strong understanding of DevOps principles and methodologies.
  • Firsthand experience managing AWS services like EC2, S3, VPC, RDS, WAF, GuardDuty, ECS, and ALB.
  • Proficiency in shell scripting.
  • Docker expertise.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Effective communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Preferred:

  • Experience with container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
  • Experience with NodeJS and Python.

Innovation Opportunity

We are always looking for ways to improve our infrastructure and development process. We encourage you to share any experience with additional technologies or solutions that you believe could be beneficial to our environment. This could include experience with cloud-native technologies, security best practices, or monitoring and logging tools.


Global Collaboration and Flexible Scheduling


We are a global company with teams spread across different time zones. To ensure smooth operations and support our international reach, this role may require occasional work outside of standard business hours. We operate a rotational schedule where on-call and support responsibilities are shared amongst the team to distribute workload fairly. This collaborative approach allows us to provide excellent service to our global user base.

title: OpenTelemetry Specialist - PAN India
jobDescription:
Greetings from Maneva!


Job Description


Job Title                              -        OpenTelemetry Specialist


Location                             -         PAN India


Experience                        -         4 - 10 Years


Job Requirements:-


  • Configure OpenTelemetry agents across diverse environments, including servers, containers, virtual machines, and cloud platforms, to collect telemetry data from various sources.
  • Design and implement instrumentation strategies to capture metrics, traces, and logs from applications, services, and infrastructure components using Open Telemetry libraries and SDKs.
  • Collaborate with development teams to instrument applications with OpenTelemetry for comprehensive observability and troubleshooting capabilities.
  • Collect telemetry data from multiple receivers, including host metrics, application metrics, trace data, and log streams, using Open Telemetry agents and exporters.
  • Scale OpenTelemetry collectors horizontally and vertically to handle increasing telemetry data volumes and ensure high availability and reliability of observability infrastructure.
  • Deploy Open Telemetry collectors in different deployment scenarios, including on-premises, cloud, hybrid, and multi-cloud environments, using containerized deployments, orchestration platforms, and infrastructure as code (IaC) tools.
  • Optimize OpenTelemetry configurations for performance, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness, considering factors such as sampling rates, data retention policies, and resource utilization.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
  • Proven experience configuring and deploying Open Telemetry agents and collectors in complex, distributed environments.
  • Strong understanding of observability concepts, including metrics, traces, logs, and their role in monitoring and troubleshooting distributed systems.
  • Proficiency in programming and scripting languages such as Python, Go, Java, or JavaScript for automation and customization of Open Telemetry instrumentation and configurations.
  • Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and infrastructure automation tools (Terraform, Ansible) for deploying and scaling Open Telemetry infrastructure

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and related AI/ML services.
  • Work closely with DevOps and SRE teams to integrate Open Telemetry with existing monitoring, alerting, and incident management workflows and tools.
  • Collaborate with architects and stakeholders to design and implement end-to-end observability architectures, encompassing data collection, processing, storage, analysis, and visualization.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in observability, distributed tracing, and telemetry data collection, and contribute to the advancement of Open Telemetry and observability standards.

title: Hiring - Devops Project Manager - Thryve Digital
jobDescription:
JOB SUMMARY

We are looking for a person who will be responsible for overseeing the entire software development lifecycle (SDLC), implementing and optimizing DevOps practices, and ensuring efficient and reliable delivery of high-quality software applications. This role requires a blend of strong leadership, technical expertise, and a collaborative spirit.


Roles & Responsibilities

  • Team Management: Lead a team of DevOps engineers, fostering a culture of high performance, continuous learning, and innovation.
  • Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve DevOps practices, including automation, infrastructure management, and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Tooling & Automation: Champion the adoption of new tools and automation strategies to optimize efficiency and reliability.
  • Collaboration: Bridge the gap between development, operations, and security teams to ensure smooth workflows.
  • Security & Compliance: Implement and maintain robust security practices throughout the software delivery lifecycle.
  • User Research: Actively gather and analyze user feedback to understand user needs and guide product development.
  • Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with stakeholders across various departments to ensure product development aligns with business objectives.
  • Metrics & Reporting: Track key product metrics and report on product success to leadership and stakeholders.
  • Communicate project status updates and roadmaps to stakeholders regularly.
  • Prepare clear and concise project documentation.
  • Manage stakeholder expectations and address concerns proactively.
  • Identify and present key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure DevOps effectiveness.

Skillsets:

  • Minimum 6+ years of experience in a DevOps Engineer role (or similar)
  • 3+ years of experience in a leadership role (or strong leadership potential)
  • Strong understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible), and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills
  • Prior experience owning a software product (a plus)
  • understanding of user research methodologies (a plus)

Mandatory to work in shift 3 pm IST to Midnight IST in hybrid.

Required

  • Bachelors degree in engineering, Master of Computer Applications, or related field

EXPERIENCE

Required

  • Ability to prioritize tasks, work independently, and work collaboratively in an agile environment.

title: DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
We're seeking a talented DevOps Engineer with a with 5-10 years of strong experience in AWS, Windows, VMWare, and Citrix.

Role Overview:
As a DevOps Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in deploying and maintaining our Windows-based products and databases on the AWS platform. Your expertise in scripting, along with your in-depth knowledge of AWS services, will be instrumental in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and security of our infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and develop deployment strategies.
- Design, implement, and automate deployment pipelines for Windows-based applications and databases on AWS.

- Optimize system performance, reliability, and cost efficiency through continuous monitoring and optimization.
- Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure issues, ensuring minimal downtime and maximum uptime.
- Stay updated with emerging technologies and best practices in DevOps and cloud computing.

title: DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
About the role

We are seeking a passionate and skilled AWS Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, deploying, and managing our infrastructure on the AWS cloud platform. You will also play a key role in automating our DevOps pipeline using Jenkins to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.


Responsibilities

  • Firsthand Management: This role requires experience in managing core AWS services including EC2, S3, VPC, RDS, WAF, GuardDuty, ECS (Elastic Container Service), and ALB (Application Load Balancer). You will be responsible for provisioning, configuring, and maintaining these services to

meet our infrastructure needs.

  • Automation Expertise: We leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and scripting to automate

infrastructure management. You will be an expert in shell scripting and adept at using Terraform

(a plus) to define and manage our infrastructure as code.

  • Containerization Champion: Docker containers are essential to our development process. You

will need strong Docker skills to build, package, and deploy containerized applications on ECS.

Experience with Kubernetes, a container orchestration platform, is a plus.

  • Modern Development Skills: While not required, experience with NodeJS and Python will be

highly regarded. These skills can be instrumental in automating tasks and developing DevOps

tools.

  • CI/CD Master: You will be instrumental in implementing and managing our CI/CD pipeline using

Jenkins (mandatory). This includes defining build jobs, configuring automated testing, and

deploying applications to production on ECS behind an ALB.


Required experience & skillsets:

  • 2-4 years of experience in cloud computing, preferably AWS.
  • Strong understanding of DevOps principles and methodologies.
  • Firsthand experience managing AWS services like EC2, S3, VPC, RDS, WAF, GuardDuty, ECS, and ALB.
  • Proficiency in shell scripting.
  • Docker expertise.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Effective communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Preferred:

  • Experience with container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
  • Experience with NodeJS and Python.

Innovation Opportunity

We are always looking for ways to improve our infrastructure and development process. We encourage you to share any experience with additional technologies or solutions that you believe could be beneficial to our environment. This could include experience with cloud-native technologies, security best practices, or monitoring and logging tools.


Global Collaboration and Flexible Scheduling


We are a global company with teams spread across different time zones. To ensure smooth operations and support our international reach, this role may require occasional work outside of standard business hours. We operate a rotational schedule where on-call and support responsibilities are shared amongst the team to distribute workload fairly. This collaborative approach allows us to provide excellent service to our global user base.

title: Cloud Devops Engineer
jobDescription:
The Cloud DevOps Engineer will design, implement, and manage cloud infrastructure solutions using AWS and Azure. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in cloud architecture, an in-depth understanding of AWS and Azure services, and at least 4 years of hands-on experience with both platforms.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Design and implement scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud solutions on AWS and Azure.
  • Collaborate with development teams to define and implement cloud architecture best practices.
  • Develop and maintain cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or ARM Templates.
  • Ensure high availability and disaster recovery solutions are in place and tested regularly.
  • Monitor cloud infrastructure performance, optimize resource usage, and implement cost-saving measures.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to cloud infrastructure and services.
  • Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in cloud technologies and integrate relevant innovations into the infrastructure.
  • Engage in cloud security and cloud audit activities.
  • Implement and manage security measures within the DevOps pipeline.
  • Automate security testing and monitoring tools to identify vulnerabilities.
  • Ensure adherence to regulatory and compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, SOC 2).
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with AWS and Azure.
  • Strong experience with cloud architecture design and implementation.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or ARM Templates.
  • Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
  • Knowledge of networking concepts, including VPNs, firewalls, and load balancers.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps.
  • Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash).
  • Database knowledge required (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB).
  • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect (Associate or Professional) and/or Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert.
  • Experience with multi-cloud environments and hybrid cloud solutions.
  • Familiarity with DevOps practices and principles.
  • Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, or Azure Monitor.

title: Azure Devops Engineer
jobDescription:
Role: DevOps Engineer

Location: Chennai (UK time zone)

Time: Full-time

Experience: 5+ years


The Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled DevOps Engineer to join our team and help transform our infrastructure and application deployment processes. This role involves setting up a greenfield Kubernetes environment in Azure, utilizing infrastructure as code, and containerizing our existing monolithic Python application. You will work closely with our development teams to streamline deployment processes, manage cloud resources, and ensure the stability and scalability of our applications.

Key Responsibilities

  • Set up and manage a greenfield Kubernetes environment in Azure.
  • Utilize infrastructure as code tools to automate the setup and deployment of Kubernetes clusters.
  • Containerize a monolithic Python application for deployment in Kubernetes.
  • Integrate and manage MySQL databases within the Kubernetes environment.
  • Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to streamline application deployment processes.
  • Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration and operation of containerized applications.
  • Monitor and optimize the performance, reliability, and scalability of the Kubernetes environment.
  • Write and maintain scripts in Python to support automation tasks and integration processes.

Required Skills

  • Strong experience with Kubernetes, particularly in setting up greenfield environments.
  • Proficiency with Azure and its services, especially related to Kubernetes and cloud infrastructure.
  • Expertise in using infrastructure as code tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible) to manage cloud resources.
  • Solid experience in containerizing applications, specifically Python applications.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipeline development and maintenance.
  • Hands-on experience with MySQL database management within a Kubernetes environment.
  • Advanced scripting skills in Python and Shell.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with development teams.

Professional Experience

  • Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer with a focus on Kubernetes and cloud infrastructure.
  • Demonstrated success in setting up and managing Kubernetes environments in Azure.
  • Prior experience containerizing monolithic applications, particularly Python-based ones.
  • Experience with infrastructure as code tools for cloud resource management.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipeline development and cloud-native application deployment.
  • Experience integrating and managing MySQL databases in a Kubernetes environment.
  • Strong background in scripting and automation.
  • Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks effectively.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

jobDescription:

You will be responsible for automating the software development lifecycle (SDLC) using DevOps principles and tools. This role requires a blend of development, operations, and cloud expertise to bridge the gap between development teams and IT operations.

title: Azure Devops Engineer
jobDescription:
Role: DevOps Engineer

Location: Chennai (UK time zone)

Time: Full-time

Experience: 5+ years

The Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled DevOps Engineer to join our team and help transform our infrastructure and application deployment processes. This role involves setting up a greenfield Kubernetes environment in Azure, utilizing infrastructure as code, and containerizing our existing monolithic Python application. You will work closely with our development teams to streamline deployment processes, manage cloud resources, and ensure the stability and scalability of our applications.

Key Responsibilities

  • Set up and manage a greenfield Kubernetes environment in Azure.
  • Utilize infrastructure as code tools to automate the setup and deployment of Kubernetes clusters.
  • Containerize a monolithic Python application for deployment in Kubernetes.
  • Integrate and manage MySQL databases within the Kubernetes environment.
  • Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to streamline application deployment processes.
  • Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration and operation of containerized applications.
  • Monitor and optimize the performance, reliability, and scalability of the Kubernetes environment.
  • Write and maintain scripts in Python to support automation tasks and integration processes.

Required Skills

  • Strong experience with Kubernetes, particularly in setting up greenfield environments.
  • Proficiency with Azure and its services, especially related to Kubernetes and cloud infrastructure.
  • Expertise in using infrastructure as code tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible) to manage cloud resources.
  • Solid experience in containerizing applications, specifically Python applications.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipeline development and maintenance.
  • Hands-on experience with MySQL database management within a Kubernetes environment.
  • Advanced scripting skills in Python and Shell.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with development teams.

Professional Experience

  • Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer with a focus on Kubernetes and cloud infrastructure.
  • Demonstrated success in setting up and managing Kubernetes environments in Azure.
  • Prior experience containerizing monolithic applications, particularly Python-based ones.
  • Experience with infrastructure as code tools for cloud resource management.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipeline development and cloud-native application deployment.
  • Experience integrating and managing MySQL databases in a Kubernetes environment.
  • Strong background in scripting and automation.
  • Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks effectively.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

title: Azure DevOps Engineer - CI/CD Pipeline
jobDescription:
Responsibilities :


- Infrastructure as Code (IaC) : Utilize Terraform to implement and manage infrastructure as code, efficiently provisioning and maintaining resources for MuleSoft applications.

- Deployment Automation : Develop deployment automation scripts using Ansible, incorporating advanced branching strategies for consistent and reliable MuleSoft application deployments.

- Build : Utilize Maven as a build and dependency management tool to automate project builds and dependencies. Troubleshoot and resolve Maven build issues.

- Azure DevOps : Harness the power of Azure DevOps for source code management, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.

- Pipeline Orchestration : Create, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps, with comprehensive documentation in Confluence and Jira, to facilitate MuleSoft integration solutions; smooth deployments and releases.

- Monitoring and Logging : Implement advanced monitoring and logging tools, including Azure Monitoring, Azure Log Analytics, and GitHub Actions, to proactively detect and troubleshoot issues.

- Security and Compliance : Adhere to security best practices and compliance requirements while managing MuleSoft deployments, using Azure Repos for secure code management.

- Scaling and Optimization : Continuously optimize infrastructure and application scaling based on performance metrics and load requirements.

- Documentation : Document infrastructure configurations, deployment processes, and best practices meticulously, ensuring knowledge sharing and accessibility.

- Collaboration : Foster seamless collaboration with development, testing, and operations teams, utilizing Confluence, Jira, and GitHub, to ensure efficient workflows and rapid issue resolution.

Qualifications and Experience :

- 5 - 8 Years of Proven experience in designing, implementing, and managing infrastructure for MuleSoft integration solutions.

- Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer with expertise in Azure DevOps, Terraform, Ansible, Confluence, Jira, Maven, GitHub, Azure Repos, Mule Runtime, and Linux.

- Strong knowledge of networking concepts and Azure networking services.

- Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like ARM templates, Terraform, or Ansible.

- Proficiency in setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines, integrating Confluence and Jira for comprehensive project management.

- Experience in Implementing and enforcing effective branching strategies to streamline code development and deployment processes.

- Experience in deploying MuleSoft applications, utilizing Azure DevOps, Terraform, or Ansible to AKS and Kubernetes in on-premise Linux environments.

- Experience in Git, Jira, and Postman

- Hands-on experience in applying end-to-end monitoring with tools like Nagios, Prometheus, New Relic, etc

- In-depth understanding of Log Aggregation, Container Monitoring, and Analytics using ELK or Splunk, Sysdig, Datadog, etc

- Advanced scripting and automation skills using PowerShell, Bash, and/or other scripting languages.

- Microsoft Azure and DevOps certifications (e.g., AZ-400 and AZ-104) are preferred.

- In-depth understanding of healthcare data privacy and security regulations, including HIPAA, applicable to MuleSoft integration solutions.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.

title: Azure DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
• We are lookingfor: Azure DevOps Engineer Profiles (this profile can have people moreoriented to Administration or Development):
  • Familiaritywith core Azure services such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, Azure Networking,Azure SQL Database, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and Azure Functions.
  • Understandingof Azure Resource Manager (ARM) and its templates YAML.
  • Understandingof microservices approach with hands-on Logic Apps, Cosmos DB, Azure PrivateEnd Points, Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage, Azure App Services, AzureService Bus, Application Insights, Event Grid, Azure Key Vault, API ManagementServices, PowerApps, PowerBI, Flows.

Infrastructureas Code (IaC) Tools:

  • Proficiencyin IaC tools such as Terraform, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, andBicep.
  • Knowledgeof how to write, test, and deploy IaC scripts using these tools.

Scriptingand Automation:

  • Experiencewith scripting languages like PowerShell and Azure CLI for automation andmanagement of Azure resources.
  • Knowledgeof YAML and JSON for writing ARM templates and other configuration files.
  • Abilityto write scripts (eg, Bash, PowerShell) to automate tasks within CI/CDpipelines.

ConfigurationManagement:

  • Familiaritywith configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet, which maybe used in conjunction with IaC. -> Not Mandatory

VersionControl Systems:

  • Proficiencyin using version control systems like Git/Azure DevOps for source codemanagement and collaboration.
  • Understandingof branching strategies and CI/CD pipelines for deploying IaC.
  • ContinuousIntegration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):
  • Experiencein setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Azure DevOps orGitHub Actions.
  • Knowledgeof integrating IaC deployment into CI/CD workflows.
  • Abilityto build scripts to run Postman collections using Newman.

Networking Concepts:

  • Understandingof virtual networks, subnets, network security groups, VPNs, and othernetworking components in Azure.
  • Abilityto configure and manage network resources using IaC.

Securityand Compliance:

  • Knowledgeof Azure security best practices and services such as Azure Security Center,Azure Policy, and role-based access control (RBAC).
  • Experiencein implementing security controls and compliance measures using IaC.

Monitoringand Logging:

  • Familiaritywith Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, Application Insights for monitoring andlogging Azure resources.
  • Abilityto set up alerts and dashboards using these tools and PowerBi dashboards.

Troubleshootingand Debugging :

  • Strongtroubleshooting and debugging skills to diagnose and resolve issues with IaCdeployments and Azure resources.

ProgrammingLanguage skills:

  • JSON,XML, C#.NET, PowerShell and Azure CLI, TypeScript

Use your skillsto move the world forward

MindSetSkills:

  • DevSecOps,Collaboration, Problem-Solving, Proactive, Continuos Improvement Commitment,Time Management
  • Basicexperience in agile, eg SAFE or SCRUM methodology and ITIL.

Trainings:

  • RelevantMicrosoft certifications such Azure DevOps Engineer Expert or pre-requiredcertifications.

title: DevOps Engineer (Linux Administration, AWS Cloud, Jenkins, Terraform )
tagsAndSkills: Linux Administration,Jenkins,AWS Infrastructure Management,DevOps,Terraform,System Architecture,AWS services,AWS Cloud
jobDescription:
DevOps Engineer (Linux Administration, AWS Cloud, Jenkins, Terraform, Puppet)
Responsibilities:
- Kubernetes Administration:
- Assist in managing and administering Kubernetes clusters, including cluster provisioning, deployment, and troubleshooting.
- Monitor and optimize cluster performance, capacity, and security under guidance.
- Support the implementation and maintenance of high availability and disaster recovery strategies for Kubernetes workloads.
- AWS Infrastructure Management:
- Assist in designing, deploying, and maintaining AWS infrastructure to support application workloads.
- Assist in configuring and optimizing AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, and IAM.
- Contribute to infrastructure provisioning and deployment automation using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
- Support monitoring and ensuring the availability, performance, and security of AWS resources.
- DevOps Implementation:
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assist in implementing and improving DevOps practices.
- Contribute to the development and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, Bamboo CI/CD, or AWS CodePipeline.
- Assist in automating software deployments, testing, and monitoring processes.
- Work closely with senior engineers and developers to adopt and apply DevOps best practices.
- System Architecture and Design:
- Contribute to the design and architecture discussions of scalable and reliable cloud-based systems.
- Assist in capacity planning and participate in system scalability initiatives.
- Identify and suggest solutions to enhance system performance, security, and cost-efficiency.
- Troubleshooting and Support:
- Collaborate with senior team members to investigate and resolve technical issues related to Kubernetes, AWS, and DevOps.
- Provide support and guidance to junior team members, as directed.
- Collaborate with product teams to address and resolve production incidents.
- Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
- Contribute to the creation and maintenance of technical documentation, including system diagrams, runbooks, and standard operating procedures.
- Share knowledge and contribute to internal knowledge bases, learning from senior team members.
Qualifications and Skills:
- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
- Some experience or familiarity with Kubernetes administration and management.
- Familiarity with AWS services, including EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, and IAM.
- Basic understanding of implementing and maintaining DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
- Exposure to Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation is a plus.
- Basic understanding of networking concepts and protocols.
- Familiarity with scripting and automation using languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
- Exposure to containerization technologies (Docker) and container orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes, Amazon EKS) is a plus.
- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to learn and troubleshoot technical issues.
- Good communication and collaboration skills.
- Certifications like Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, or similar are a plus.
If you are a highly motivated and skilled engineer with a passion for learning and contributing to Kubernetes administration, AWS, and DevOps, we would love to hear from you.

title: DevOps Lead Engineer - Immediate - Chennai
jobDescription:
Lead Engineer: 8 - 12 years of Experience


We are looking for a DevOps Lead Engineer to join our team of talented engineers who share a common interest in products for EdTech, FinTech and various industries. You will be a polyglot engineer and have responsibility for delivering DevOps requirements of our products/projects, and continuously improve our engineering practices.


What you will do?

    • Take the needs and challenges of the customer and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support the business strategies and goals.
    • Provide technical leadership across DevOps areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions.
    • Design, develop, and maintain infrastructure as code using tools like Terraform, Ansible, and AWS CDK.
    • Deploy and manage Kubernetes clusters.
    • Architect and develop microservices-based applications.
    • Utilize strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure services including Event Grid, Service Bus, SQL Server, and Function Apps.
    • Implement and enforce Azure security features and best practices.
    • Ensure compliance with Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.
    • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks.
    • Become a trusted and valued partner of the CTO, and Head of Engineering Delivery.
    • Maintain strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products.
    • You will mentor the (senior) engineers and DevOps team in Crystal Delta.
    • Work from our office in Chennai or Aruppukkottai and if needed travel to Melbourne (Australia) on short term.

Who are you?


    • You have 8 - 12 years of experience in DevOps practice.
    • You are an expert in Azure and preferably a certified professional architect.
    • You are an architect or leading and inspiring DevOps teams to build a strong DevOps culture.
    • You have significant experience in architecting enterprise applications.
    • Proven experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, Ansible, and AWS CDK.
    • Strong experience with Kubernetes deployment and management.
    • You have strong experience in setting up enterprise level CI/CD.
    • In-depth understanding of microservices architectures.
    • Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Azure, including services like Azure Event Grid, Service Bus, SQL Server, and Function Apps.
    • Ability to optimise infrastructure cost.
    • You have experience in setting up Monitoring and Alerting solutions to proactively notify engineers when systems fail.
    • Research and make recommendations on services and technology.
    • You have a solid understanding of the practical application of agile development methods and leading software development teams in an Agile/Lean/Continuous Delivery environment.
    • You are a continuous learner and influence the team to be learning continuously.

We have an immediate opening for Lead Engineer and interested kindly share your resume to sasikumar@crystaldelta.com


Experience - 10+ years

Notice Period - 15 days / Immediate Joiner

title: DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
• As a Sr. DevOps Engineer specializing in Terraform, you will play a pivotal role in our IT infrastructure and operations team.
  • You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure as code using Terraform, while collaborating closely with development and operations teams to streamline processes and enhance system reliability.
Roles and Responsibilities
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Develop, maintain, and optimize infrastructure code using
    Terraform to provision and manage cloud resources.
  • Automation: Design and implement automation scripts and processes for provisioning,
    configuration, and deployment of infrastructure and applications.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with software development and operations teams to
    understand their requirements and ensure seamless integration of infrastructure
    changes.
  • Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Implement and maintain
    CI/CD pipelines to automate software deployments and releases.
  • Monitoring and Logging: Set up and manage monitoring, logging, and alerting systems
    to proactively identify and address issues.
  • Security: Ensure the security of infrastructure by implementing best practices and
    staying updated on security vulnerabilities and threats.
  • Performance Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and ensure
    high availability of systems.
  • Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of infrastructure configurations and
    processes.
Qualification
  • Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or
    equivalent work experience).
  • 6+ years of hands-on experience in DevOps, with a strong emphasis on Terraform.
  • Proven experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP). Azure will be
    preferred.
  • Proficiency in scripting and automation using languages such as Bash, Python, or
    PowerShell.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration with
    Kubernetes is a plus.
  • Knowledge of infrastructure monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, ELK Stack).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team
    environment.
  • Excellent communication skills to interact with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
  • Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, HashiCorp Certified:
    Terraform Associate) are a plus.

title: DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
Role/Job Title: DevOps Engineer
Function/Department: Information Technology
Job Purpose:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer with a primary focus on AWS cloud services. The ideal candidate will be proficient in automated provisioning, cloud management, and possess expertise in tools such as Terraform and Packer. As a DevOps Lead, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining our cloud infrastructure to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and scalability.
Roles and Responsibilities:
  • AWS Cloud Management: Design, deploy, and manage AWS cloud infrastructure. Optimize and maintain cloud resources for performance and cost efficiency. Monitor and ensure the security of cloud-based systems.
  • Automated Provisioning: Develop and implement automated provisioning processes for infrastructure deployment. Utilize tools like Terraform and Packer to automate and streamline the provisioning of resources.
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Champion the use of Infrastructure as Code principles. Collaborate with development and operations teams to define and maintain IaC scripts for infrastructure deployment and configuration.
  • Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and provide DevOps expertise. Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders regarding infrastructure changes, updates, and improvements.
  • Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery processes. Ensure reliable and efficient deployment of applications through the development lifecycle.
  • Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Implement monitoring solutions to track system performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize resource utilization. Proactively identify opportunities for system and process improvements.
Mandatory Skills:
  • Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role, with a focus on AWS.
  • Strong proficiency in automated provisioning and cloud management.
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools, particularly Terraform and Packer.
  • Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines and version control systems.
  • Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash) for automation tasks.
  • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills for effective collaboration.
Secondary Skills:
  • AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect).
  • Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Knowledge of microservices architecture and serverless computing.
  • Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., CloudWatch, ELK stack).
Education Qualification (Fulltime):
Graduation: Bachelor of Science (B.Sc) / Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) / Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA)
Post-Graduation: Master of Science (M.Sc) /Master of Technology (M.Tech) / Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
Experience: 5 to 10 Years

title: DevOps Engineering Manager
jobDescription:
Role/Job Title: DevOps Engineering Manager
Function/Department: Information Technology
Job Purpose:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic DevOps Engineering Manager with a strong background in AWS cloud services. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on leader, proficient in automated provisioning, cloud management, and possess expertise in Financial Operations (FinOps) with a focus on resource optimization. If you are passionate about building and leading high-performing DevOps teams while ensuring efficient and cost-effective cloud infrastructure, we invite you to apply.
Roles and Responsibilities:
  • AWS Cloud Management: Lead the design, deployment, and management of AWS cloud infrastructure to ensure scalability, security, and reliability. Oversee the implementation of best practices for cloud resource utilization.
  • Automated Provisioning: Drive the development and maintenance of automated provisioning processes for infrastructure deployment, leveraging tools such as Terraform and Packer. Continuously enhance deployment workflows to optimize efficiency.
  • Financial Operations (FinOps): Implement and champion FinOps practices to optimize cloud costs and resource utilization. Conduct regular cost analysis and identify opportunities for cost savings without compromising performance.
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Collaborate with teams to implement and maintain IaC scripts for infrastructure configuration and deployment. Ensure version control and consistency in infrastructure code across projects.
  • Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of DevOps engineers, providing technical guidance and support. Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture focused on continuous improvement.
  • Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Drive the implementation and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery processes. Ensure seamless and reliable application deployments across environments.
  • Monitoring and Optimization: Implement monitoring solutions for cloud resources and applications. Proactively identify and address performance bottlenecks, ensuring optimal system performance.
Mandatory Skills:
  • Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer, with experience managing and leading teams.
  • Strong proficiency in AWS cloud services, automated provisioning, and cloud management.
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools, particularly Terraform and Packer.
  • Expertise in FinOps and optimizing cloud resources for cost efficiency.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and scripting languages.
  • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Secondary Skills:
  • AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect).
  • Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Knowledge of microservices architecture and serverless computing.
  • Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., CloudWatch, ELK stack).
  • Previous experience with financial management of cloud resources.
  • Strong communication and leadership skills.
Education Qualifications:
Graduation: Bachelor of Science (B.Sc) / Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) / Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA)
Post-Graduation: Master of Science (M.Sc) / Master of Technology (M.Tech) / Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
Experience: 10 to 18 Years

title: Devops Engineer Opening - Azentio Software !!
jobDescription:
Job Title: Software Engineer

Years of Experience: 5 - 7 Years


Location: Chennai (Hybrid) (3rd Floor, Prince Infocity-II, Rajiv Gandhi Salai, Kandhanchavadi, Chennai, India 600096)


Primary Skills: Proficiency in automation tools like Jenkins, Ansible, or Puppet, knowledge of scripting languages like Python or Bash, understanding of containerization with Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes, experience with JIRA, familiarity with version control systems like Git, and experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, OCI or Google Cloud.


What we Aim for?

Azentio aims to be the leading provider of Banking, Financial Services & Insurance (BFSI) & Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software products in Asia Pacific, Middle East & Africa & United States. We will achieve this by:

  • Providing world class software products, built on the latest technologies.
  • Providing best in class customer service, built on a deep understanding of our domains and local nuances.
  • Being an employer of choice, attracting high quality talent.
  • Achieving top quartile growth and margins.

Role Summary:

DevOps engineering role involves leading and executing the implementation of DevOps practices within an organization. Responsibilities include designing and architecting scalable infrastructure, developing CI/CD pipelines, automating tasks and processes, ensuring monitoring and security measures, optimizing performance and scalability, fostering collaboration, mentoring junior team members, and staying current with industry trends. Overall, DevOps engineers play a crucial role in driving efficiency, reliability, and continuous improvement in product delivery through the adoption of DevOps principles and practices.


What will you do?

  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable and highly available infrastructure solutions using on-prem datacentres and cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, OCI or Google Cloud. This includes designing architectures that are resilient, secure, and cost-effective.
  • Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment processes. This involves selecting and configuring appropriate tools and technologies such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or CircleCI.
  • Automate repetitive tasks and processes using scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell. They also utilize configuration management tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef to automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration, and management. Additionally, they orchestrate containerized applications using tools like Kubernetes.
  • Implement and maintain monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to ensure the health, performance, and availability of applications and infrastructure. This involves setting up tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana), or Datadog.
  • Work closely with security teams to implement best practices for security, compliance, and risk management. They ensure that security measures are integrated into every aspect of the development and deployment process, including infrastructure configuration, code deployment, and access control.
  • Optimize the performance and scalability of applications and infrastructure by identifying bottlenecks, tuning configurations, and implementing performance monitoring and optimization strategies.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including development, operations, and QA to drive DevOps adoption and best practices within the organization. They mentor and provide technical guidance to junior team members and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
  • Stay abreast of the latest trends, tools, and technologies in DevOps, cloud computing, automation, and software development methodologies. They evaluate new technologies and tools to assess their suitability for the organization's needs.

What is expected from an individual?

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering or a related field.
  • 5 - 7 years of experience in DevOps or related roles, with a proven track record of designing and implementing complex infrastructure solutions.
  • Proficiency in scripting and automation using languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
  • Hands-on experience with configuration management tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
  • Expertise in containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration with Kubernetes.
  • Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with on-prem datacentres and cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, OCI or Google Cloud.
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, CircleCI).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues in distributed systems.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
  • Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes Administrator)

title: Associate DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
•   The Associate DevOps Engineer will perform an Applications Support role responding to incidents and service requests on Trimble s products and platforms that impact Trimble customers.
  • You will have exposure to a wide range of technologies and industries which Trimble operates in.
  • You will be required to follow runbooks and investigate/resolve incidents and fulfill requests in a timely manner.
  • You will be working closely with Cloud Engineers, Site Reliability Engineers and Service Managers to expand your knowledge and develop your technical capabilities.
  • This role requires you to build a knowledge of technologies, practices, and procedures within the role. Being able to follow standard practices and procedures in analyzing problems from which answers can be readily obtained.
  • You will receive detailed instruction, guidance and direction from more senior level roles.
Educational
  • Bachelors degree in a relevant field of study. A degree can generally be substituted with relevant work experience and/or a certificate/training program in addition to the guidelines listed below. Relevant fields of study include but are not limited to:
    • Computer Science
    • Computer Engineering
    • Software Engineering
    • Information Technology
    • Information Systems
Work Experience
  • From 1-2 years experience
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities - Must-Haves
  • Communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively in a team-oriented environment.
  • Awareness and appreciation of working to Service Levels
  • Problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze and resolve routine technical issues.
  • Ability to follow standard practices, procedures and work instructions to execute tasks under detailed instruction and guidance.
  • Eagerness to learn, adapt, and contribute to a collaborative and dynamic work environment.
  • Awareness of ITIL processes/practices
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Familiarity with operating systems (Linux, Windows) and command-line interfaces.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities - Nice-to-Haves
  • Basic understanding of software development concepts and programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript, or similar)
  • Understanding of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices.
  • Understanding of containerization technologies (e.g., Docker).
  • Basic understanding of networking concepts.
Travel
  • Travel is typically not required for Development and Operations Engineering positions.
Schedule
  • This position requires a flexible schedule, which will include morning shifts and late night shifts on rotation.
Management Responsibilities
  • The Associate DevOps Engineer role is an individual contributor and does not manage other employees.

title: DevOps Engineer
jobDescription:
• Build, test, deploy & monitor IT hardware and software by automation and ensure that the systems availability, security and performance are adherent to SLAs for various projects in a rapidly changing IT environment
  • Use required tools, technologies & services to create, maintain, and upgrade IT systems for secure, scalable, reliable, high performing applications and platforms in cloud and on-premise servers
  • Use required tools and services for collaboration, issue tracking, cloud/IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, CI/CD/CT, package managers, source control, release orchestration, monitoring and analytics
  • Setup, test & maintain continuous testing, continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines
  • Setup, test & maintain data observability pipelines
  • Create & maintain IT infrastructure as code
  • Enable data management: governance, regulatory compliance & privacy, disaster recovery, backup, master-slave setup. etc
  • Enable SIEM & UEBA in our platform
  • Enable ISO27001, PCI-DSS certifications of IT systems
  • Maintain semantic version control of source, software s & resources
  • Manage software licensing, upgrades and vulnerabilities
  • Automate code review using tools like Sonar Cube
  • Maintain updates for new product releases
  • Work with cross-functional teams to ensure system quality
  • Manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
  • Versatile and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the tech stack

Technical Skills:

  • Container orchestration with Kubernetes using: KOPS, Kubespray, Kubeadm & Multi-cluster Kubernetes management using: Rancher or similar
  • Kubernetes Cluster Management - Automated provisioning system, fully automated installation, Self-healing, High-Availability, Service discovery & load balancing and Application upgrades & rollbacks
  • Kubernetes workloads, networking, APIs, security policies, certificates, metrics, logs etc
  • Containerization: Predominantly Docker, Knowledge on CRI-O, containerd is a plus
  • Popular Linux distributions based desktop and server environment administration and shell scripting
  • Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Git, Ansible, Terraform, npm, Maven, Helm Charts
  • Observability tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, APM, Sentry, Nagios
  • AWS or Azure Certification in any above mentioned specializations is a plus
Soft Skills:

  • Outcome driven
  • Resilient and ability to learn evolving technologies required for this job description
  • Problem solving skills
  • Working proficiency in verbal and written English

Qualifications:

B.E. in C.S. or a related field and 3 to 5 years exp in 3 or more of the following:


  • Experience in deploying AWS cloud services like EMR, S3, Redshift, Lambda, DynamoDB, RDS, SNS, SQS, Glue, Athena, Code Deploy, Code Pipeline etc
  • Experience in migrating and implementation of applications from on-premise to cloud using AWS or Azure web services
  • Experience in deploying and maintaining Big data technologies in Apache Software Foundation
  • Experience in Enterprise Kubernetes management using Rancher, AWS EKS, GKE, AKS
  • Experience in managing Stateful and Stateless applications
  • Experience in setting up test, staging and production environments involving multiple technology stack s
  • Experience in deploying different system architectures: Distributed, Centralized & Federated
  • Experience in setting up hybrid environment - private data center and public cloud endpoints to deliver hybrid clusters
